text:
The "unknown secret" error is coming after an HTTP 401, unauthorized to <http://sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com|sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>. It's possible that the error message is inaccurate, as some of the SVs return HTTP 401 when you're not whitelisted.

Can you verify if you're whitelisted by <http://sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com|sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com> yet? We found that even having 2/3 SVs whitelisted wasn't necessarily enough for us to get online.

text:
Hi all - I'm trying to figure out how to backup our Identities on DevNet, but keep getting this error:

```$   curl --request GET \
  --url <http://10.43.193.186:5003/api/validator/v0/admin/participant/identities> \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer 
{"error":"Authorization Failed for figment-devnet-validator-1::1220aabc5bf0..."}```
The Bearer token is taken from the `Daml Ledger API`  in Auth0. Any idea why this is failing?

elements.text: Hi all - I'm trying to figure out how to backup our Identities on DevNet, but keep getting this error:

$   curl --request GET \
  --url
The Bearer token is taken from the
Daml Ledger API
in Auth0. Any idea why this is failing?

text:
I faced this issue; it had set the wrong audience in the validator.
SPLICE_APP_VALIDATOR_AUTH_AUDIENCE had a different value.

elements.text:
I faced this issue; it had set the wrong audience in the validator.
SPLICE_APP_VALIDATOR_AUTH_AUDIENCE had a different value.

root.text:
Hello team, thank you for letting me in.
We have created a dev machine running Canton's Docker image. We were able to view the wallet GUI (localhost on port 80), but I'm having trouble allowing other users to view it through a secure channel. We're trying to access this dev server via an nginx instance that does SSL termination, but the GUI refuses to load. It asks for a login (administrator), but then there's a loading screen and an error. Any advice on how to configure your dev component so that external users can access it securely?
Another issue - how can we attach this docker to our dev wallet?  is it related to the "party_hint" argument?  I have ran the script with  -p "ef-wallet-1" -m "2" -w  args, yet your people have said they are not seeing us on your side. Please advise.

elements.text:
Hello team, thank you for letting me in.
We have created a dev machine running Canton's Docker image. We were able to view the wallet GUI (localhost on port 80), but I'm having trouble allowing other users to view it through a secure channel. We're trying to access this dev server via an nginx instance that does SSL termination, but the GUI refuses to load. It asks for a login (administrator), but then there's a loading screen and an error. Any advice on how to configure your dev component so that external users can access it securely?
Another issue - how can we attach this docker to our dev wallet?  is it related to the "party_hint" argument?  I have ran the script with  -p "ef-wallet-1" -m "2" -w  args, yet your people have said they are not seeing us on your side. Please advise.

text: Can anyone assist?

elements.text: Can anyone assist?

text: To increase chances of a response I'd suggest to split two issues into two separate messages and add more technical details. Alternatively you could reach out to Digital Asset for the discretionary support

elements.text: To increase chances of a response I'd suggest to split two issues into two separate messages and add more technical details. Alternatively you could reach out to Digital Asset for the discretionary support
